metadata.Description: The principle that requires the consent of indigenous communities before any decision or action is taken that may affect their rights or lands.

level 1.Description: Free prior and informed consent implements building standards that ensure the rights of indigenous communities are respected in development projects.
Free prior and informed consent provides funding for community development programs that empower indigenous communities.
Free prior and informed consent focuses on conducting environmental impact assessments to ensure the protection of indigenous lands and resources.
Free prior and informed consent is recognized as a right under international human rights law.
Free prior and informed consent partners with indigenous peoples organizations to ensure meaningful participation in decision-making processes.
Free prior and informed consent contributes to sustainable development by promoting the rights and well-being of indigenous communities.
Free prior and informed consent monitors resource extraction projects to ensure compliance with indigenous rights and environmental standards.
Free prior and informed consent targets government policies to ensure the recognition and protection of indigenous rights.

level 2.Subject: environmental impact assessments
level 2.Description: Environmental impact assessments employ the expertise of environmental experts to evaluate the potential environmental effects of energy projects.

level 2.Subject: environmental impact assessments
level 2.Description: Environmental impact assessments collaborate with government agencies to ensure compliance with environmental regulations and standards.

level 2.Subject: environmental impact assessments
level 2.Description: Environmental impact assessments administer the process of evaluating and assessing the potential environmental impacts of energy projects.

level 2.Subject: environmental impact assessments
level 2.Description: Environmental impact assessments align with environmental regulations to ensure compliance and minimize the negative environmental impacts of energy projects.

level 2.Subject: environmental impact assessments
level 2.Description: Environmental impact assessments are an instance of the broader practice of environmental assessment, specifically focused on energy projects.

level 3.Subject: environmental impact assessments
level 3.Description: Environmental impact assessments employ the expertise of environmental experts to evaluate the potential environmental effects of energy projects.
